clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 and 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 PET/CT in Patients With Various Types of Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 and 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 PET/CT in Patients With Various Types of Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the potential usefulness of 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 positron emission tomography/computed tomography (PET/CT) for the diagnosis of primary and metastatic lesions in various types of cancer, compared with 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 PET/CT.

detailed_description.textblock: In order to enhance the tumor uptake and tumor retention time, we designed the dimer structure of fibroblast activation protein inhibitor (FAPI), a novel imaging agent that targeting cancer-associated fibroblasts expressed in various types of cancer, 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2. Subjects with various types of cancer underwent contemporaneous 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 and 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 PET/CT either for an initial assessment or for recurrence detection. Tumor uptake was quantified by the maximum standard uptake value (SUVmax). The sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value (PPV), negative predictive value (NPV) and accuracy of 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 and 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 PET/CT were calculated and compared to evaluate the diagnostic efficacy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects with various types of cancer undergo contemporaneous 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 and 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 PET/CT either for an initial assessment or for recurrence detection.

primary_outcome.description: Standardized uptake value (SUV) of 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 / 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 for each primary tumor of subject or suspected lymph metastasis.

secondary_outcome.description: The positive predictive value (PPV) of 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 and 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 PET/CT
The negative predictive value (NPV) of 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 and 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 PET/CT

Mean absorbed radiation doses were estimated using the source and target organ framework. Five patients with different cancers underwent serial 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2 PET/CT scans at three time points following radiotracer injection: 10 minutes, 1 hour, and 3 hours. The source organs consisted of the kidneys, bladder, liver, heart, spleen, bone marrow, uterus, and body remainder. OLINDA/EXM software was used to fit and integrate the kinetic organ activity data to yield total body and organ time-integrated activity coefficients/residence times and finally organ absorbed doses.

arm_group.description: Each subject receive a single intravenous injection of and 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 and 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2, and undergo PET/CT imaging within the specified time.

intervention.description: Each subject receive a single intravenous injection of 68Ga-DOTA-FAPI-46 and 68Ga-DOTA-2P(FAPI)2, and undergo PET/CT imaging within the specified time.

overall_official.affiliation: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

facility.name: The First affiliated hospital of xiamen university

clinical_study.keyword: Diagnosis, Tumor, Solid, FAPI, PET/CT, Metastasis
